business.headline: Google to invest $10 billion in Visakhapatnam data hub: ReportThe project will include the construction of three high-capacity submarine cables, dedicated cable landing stations, metro fibre networks, and advanced telecommunications infrastructure.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 5th straight session; Tata Group shares in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex opened firm and was trading 159.69 points higher at 82,086.44 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 39.15 points to 25,147.45. Broader market indices also mirrored the positive sentiment, with most trading in the green.

Tata Capital IPO: Will it reward investors like other Tata Group listings?While Tata Capital enjoys strong brand credibility and steady growth, early subscription data and grey market trends indicate a modest response so far for the public listing.

Noel Tata, Chandrasekaran meet Amit Shah amid Tata Trust governance row: ReportNoel Tata was joined by Venu Srinivasan, chairman emeritus of TVS Motor Company, and senior lawyer Darius Khambata for the meeting, which took place at Amit Shah's residence.

PF claim maze unlocked: How solutions and reforms can restore faithMillions of salaried Indians rely on the Employees' Provident Fund for financial security, yet claiming it remains a maze. Experts propose steps and technological fixes to make the process smoother and hassle-free.

Pulse crisis: Why are prices crashing below MSP despite high demand?Despite this rising import bill, instead of expansion, the area under pulses cultivation has shrunk. Over the past four years, the area under pulses has declined by nearly 3.1 million hectares.

Sensex, Nifty gain for 4th straight session as investors expect strong Q2 earningsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136.63 points to close at 81,926.75, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 30.65 points higher at 25,108.30. Broader market indices also ended the session largely positive, supported by easing volatility and sustained optimism around the upcoming quarterly earnings season.

WeWork India IPO hit by InGovern's concerns over finances days before listingInGovern pointed out that the company has reported negative cash flows for several financial years, suggesting that its operations have yet to generate consistent income.

Not getting benefit of lower prices under GST 2.0? Here's what to doA recent LocalCircles survey that received over 78,000 responses from more than 27,000 people across 332 districts suggested that the benefits of GST 2.0 are reaching consumers unevenly.

World Bank sees India growth at 6.5% for FY26, 6.3% for FY27In its latest South Asia Development Update, the World Bank highlighted that South Asia's overall growth is expected to slow to 5.8% in 2026, down from 6.6% in 2025, with trade disruptions and emerging technologies, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), creating fresh uncertainties for the region.

Why the 50-30-20 budget rule doesn't work for everyone, explains expertThe popular 50-30-20 budgeting rule has guided millions of people for decades. But personal finance expert says it often overlooks individual goals and may leave you short of what you actually need.
Here's how much salary hike employees can expect in 2026According to Aon's Annual Salary Increase and Turnover Survey 2025-26 for India, employees can expect an average salary hike of 9% next year.

New airport drives up real estate prices in Navi MumbaiThe development has already pushed property prices in surrounding areas such as Panvel, Ulwe, and Kharghar, as investors and developers rush to capitalise on the opportunities the airport promises.

UPI to introduce facial and fingerprint authentication soon: ReportUPI is set to allow users to authenticate transactions using facial recognition and fingerprints, according to sources. This new feature is expected to go live soon.

Pension hike after 11 years? All-important EPFO meeting to decide soonAfter more than a decade, pensioners may finally get some relief. The EPFO is set to discuss raising the minimum pension under EPS-95 during its upcoming board meeting in Bengaluru on October 10–11.

LG Electronics IPO: GMP hints at strong listing, but is it really a good bet?Early signals from the market suggest strong demand. The Grey Market Premium, for instance, is reported at Rs 318, implying a potential listing price of around Rs 1,458 per share, roughly 28% above the upper end of the price band.
Gold prices hit another record high: Invest now or wait?With gold hitting new all-time highs, investors are asking: should I buy now, or wait for prices to stabilise?

Out of stock: How GST rate cuts have left companies scrambling for supplyLarge-screen televisions and premium mobile phones have gone out of stock in many parts of the country as manufacturers misjudged the post-GST demand surge.
Tata Capital IPO Day 2: Check GMP, subscription status and moreThe Tata Capital IPO is set to close on Wednesday, October 8, with allotment scheduled for October 9 and listing on October 13.

ITR processed but tax refund still pending? Here's what you should doMany taxpayers are finding themselves in a fix this year; their Income Tax Returns (ITRs) show "processed", but the refund hasn't reached their bank accounts yet. If you're one of them, here's what might be causing the delay and what you can do about it.

entertainment.headline: Janhvi Kapoor, Shikhar enjoy luxury shopping spree in Paris together. Watch Janhvi Kapoor and rumoured boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya painted Paris streets red with their chemistry as they stepped out for an outing together. The actor was in the French Quarter to attend Paris Fashion Week.

Soha Ali shares how Sharmila Tagore ditched car and took lifts to beat traffic Soha Ali Khan said how Sharmila Tagore, living on her own in Delhi, ditched her car and took lifts from strangers to reach a book launch at the age of 80.

Explained: Why imitating Kantara's Daiva acts hurt Rishab Shetty, Tulu community 'Kantara: Chapter 1' fans have sparked controversy by imitating sacred Daiva rituals at theatres. Rishab Shetty and the producers appealed to fans urging them to respect the spiritual traditions and stop trivialising the practices.

Ayushmann Khurrana on films with Sooraj Barjatya, Dharma; talks about hybrid cinema At FICCI Frames 2025, Ayushmann Khurrana spoke about his love for hybrid films that blend entertainment with meaningful themes, calling it an extension of his theatre roots. He also confirmed his upcoming collaborations with Sooraj Barjatya, promising to continue taking creative risks.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 6: Eventful Tuesday, film grosses Rs 400 crore Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has grossed Rs 400 crore worldwide within six days of release. The film's Hindi and Kannada versions are driving strong box office performance, signalling its widespread appeal.

Behind Kantara's fire: Rishab-Pragathi Shetty's story of faith, sacrifice, cinema In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, Rishab Shetty and wife Pragathi Shetty open up about the making of 'Kantara Chapter 1', balancing family with filmmaking, and how faith, hard work, and passion shaped the cinematic phenomenon.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 45: Neelam refuses to cook after Gaurav's nomination jibe The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw Neelam Giri refusing to cook after Gaurav Khanna took a jibe at her during the nomination task. Tanya Mittal also had an emotional breakdown after Malti Chahar threw her into the pool.

Adivi Sesh's Dacoit may miss Christmas release after actor suffers leg injury Actor Adivi Sesh suffered a leg injury while performing an intense chase sequence in Hyderabad last week. As a result, his highly anticipated film 'Dacoit' could face a delay in release.

Priyanka, Mahesh Babu in talks for dance number in Rajamouli's Globe Trotter Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's highly anticipated film, 'Globe Trotter', could have a special dance number featuring actors Priyanka Chopra and Mahesh Babu. The makers have been brainstorming a celebratory track.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 in trouble, set sealed over environmental breach The set of 'Bigg Boss Kannada Season 12' has been sealed over environmental violations. The contestants of the reality show are expected to walk out of the premises soon.

Delhi Chief minister Rekha Gupta praises Kantara, meets Rishab Shetty Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta recently met actor Rishab Shetty and the team of 'Kantara Chapter 1' in New Delhi. She shared photos of their meeting on social media and praised the film for celebrating the country's spiritual and cultural traditions.

Ranveer-Deepika's new Abu Dhabi ad celebrates travel, love, and self-discovery Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone reunited for a stunning new campaign that captures the charm of Abu Dhabi. Blending romance with culture, the duo explored the emirate's iconic landmarks, turning their journey into a celebration of travel, love, and self-discovery.

Telugu web series D/o Prasad Rao: Kanabadutaledu to premiere on OTT in October Directed by Poluru Krishna, 'D/o Prasad Rao: Kanabadutaledu' starring Rajeev Kanakala, Udaya Bhanu, and Vasanthika, is set to start streaming on OTT from the end of October.

Black Phone 2: Ethan Hawke returns as the Ghost Grabber in a chilling new chapter 'The Black Phone 2', hitting theatres on October 17, brings Ethan Hawke back as the menacing Ghost Grabber. The sequel dives into Finn and Gwen's struggle to escape the lingering horrors of their past, blending psychological tension with chilling supernatural terror.

Thamma: Nora Fatehi stuns in retro themed spooky dance track Dilbar Ki Aankhon Ka Actor Nora Fatehi features in the new dance track 'Dilbar Ki Aankhon Ka' in 'Thamma'. She had earlier appeared in the song in the horror-comedy 'Stree' (2018).

BTS V wins over fans at Paris Fashion Week with sweet Uma Thurman moment BTS member V attends Celine Paris Fashion Week, attracting significant attention. A brief gesture towards actor Uma Thurman becomes widely shared online.

Mahayoddha Rama trailer: Ramayana gets a grand animated makeover for Diwali The animated film 'Mahayoddha Rama' offers a modern retelling of the Ramayana, blending traditional mythology with cutting-edge animation. It will release in theatres on October 17.

Exclusive: Navya Naveli on legacy, purpose and empowering Indian women with tech Navya Naveli Nanda empowers women in Haryana with AI skills. In an exclusive interview with us, she talks about combining her family's legacy with impact to build India's new future.

Ananya Panday shares frame with Pedro Pascal, Jennie at Paris Fashion Week gala Actor Ananya Panday made her Paris Fashion Week debut in style as she attended the BoF 500 Gala, meeting global stars like Pedro Pascal and Blackpink's Jennie. Her star-studded evening and stunning all-black look have set social media abuzz.

general news.headline: Video: Massive fire, blasts as tanker rams LPG truck on Jaipur highway; 1 deadThe accident took place in the Maujmabad region, causing a plume of thick black smoke to rise into the sky, visible from several kilometres away.

This is your PM in the cockpit: Starmer leads UK's biggest trade mission to India  Live UpdatesUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer kicked off Britain's largest-ever trade mission to India with a witty in-flight address from the cockpit, ahead of talks with PM Modi to boost bilateral trade and investment.
ED raids Malayalam superstar Mammootty's film production company in ChennaiThe Enforcement Directorate has raided Malayalam superstar Mammootty's film production company in Chennai.

Navi Mumbai airport takes off, PM to unveil city's 2nd international hub todayPrime Minister will inaugurate the first phase of Navi Mumbai International Airport today, a Rs. 19,650 crore project. The new airport is expected to ease congestion and drive economic growth in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region.

Pak to get air-to-air missiles from US as ties warm after Trump-Asim Munir meetPakistan's inclusion in the latest US missile contract signalled a reset in military ties between Islamabad and Washington, weeks after President Donald Trump met Shehbaz Sharif and Asim Munir at the Oval Office.

Indian man fighting for Russian military surrenders to Ukrainian forcesA 22-year-old Indian from Gujarat has reportedly surrendered to Ukrainian forces after fighting for Russia. He claims he joined to avoid a prison sentence.

Arattai app to get end-to-end encryption soon, CEO Mani Vembu says it is the top priorityArattai app will be getting new features in the coming months, including end-to-end encryption. In a conversation with India Today Tech, Zoho CEO highlights company's future plans for Arattai.

Is Shubman Gill being hurried into all-format captaincy?Star Indian batter Shubman Gill has been appointed as India's new ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma. So far, Gill has captained in only 11 international matches and has never led in ODIs. His rapid rise to multi-format captaincy could come with its own set of challenges.

AI an existential threat to the very creation of credible news: Aroon PurieIndia Today Group Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie warned that AI poses an existential threat to the creation of credible news, as it can replicate and monetise journalism without accountability. Speaking at FICCI Frames 2025, he said AI's rise, coupled with billionaire-owned media and algorithm-driven platforms, is eroding trust and the economic foundation of independent journalism.

Can a cluttered home lead to a messy breakup?Clutter isn't just chaos at home, it's chaos in your mind, your energy, and your love life. Experts, survey, and studies all warn: a disorganised home can be a silent red flag between partners.

Minister's surprise raid at sub-registrar's office leads to hidden cash discoveryMaharashtra Revenue Minister, Chandrashekhar Bawankule, conducted an unannounced raid at the Nagpur sub-registrar's office on Monday in response to multiple complaints regarding officials demanding bribes from citizens seeking land and property registrations.

Highway hell: 20-km jam on Delhi-Kolkata route, vehicles stuck for 3 daysA massive traffic jam on National Highway 19, which connects Kolkata and Delhi, has left vehicles stuck for 3 days in Bihar's Sasaram.

Canadian PM Carney credits Trump for bringing peace between India, PakistanMark Carney praised Donald Trump for bringing peace between India and Pakistan, calling him a transformative president. The remarks mark a shift in Canada's stance following tensions over Trump's tariff threats and his annexation comments.

How India's lifestyle choices are increasing the risk of blindnessDespite many lifestyle diseases being preventable, many people skip regular eye check-ups, leading to late diagnoses of vision loss or blindness. India already has one-third of the world's visually impaired population, making it especially vulnerable to diabetic eye disease.

Swedish Academy of Sciences to award Chemistry Nobel todayThe Nobel Prize, awarded by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, is considered the highest honour in the field, and will be revealed in Stockholm on October 8, 2025.

Dhravya Shah leaves IIT prep to launch AI startup, raises $3 million19-year-old Mumbai-born Dhravya Shah has turned heads in Silicon Valley after his AI startup, Supermemory, secured $3 million in seed funding from Google executives.

Why motel business is getting Gujaratis killed in USThree Gujarati people linked to the motel business were killed last week in Pennsylvania and North Carolina in two separate incidents. In all, seven Gujarat-origin people have been killed in motel crimes across the US this year. Gujaratis own 60% of the motel business in the US. Why is the motel business so risky, and how are Gujaratis coming in harm's way?

One-third of Silicon Valley is Indian. That's not a flex, it's an escapeBragging that one-third of Silicon Valley tech workers are Indian is no longer impressive. With record placement failures at IITs and a decaying syllabus, it's time we stopped hiding behind diaspora success. Here are six reasons why we strongly believe so.

sports.headline: Manchester United will win Premier League: Michael Owen's hope coded with warning Michael Owen told India Today that Manchester United's struggles go beyond Ruben Amorim. Structural flaws, inconsistency, and lack of cohesion persist, but with patience the Red Devils will return to glory.

Dravid's philosophies helped India win Champions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma India captain Rohit Sharma credited former coach Rahul Dravid's vision for their 2025 Champions Trophy success. Sharma said that the processes set by Dravid helped the team even after the coach left.

IND vs WI: Batting pitch likely in Delhi after woeful Windies show in Ahmedabad The second Test match in Delhi is likely to have a batting-friendly pitch that slowly turns into a spinning track. This comes in stark difference to the track that was dished out in the 2023 Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Rodrygo opens up on personally tough 2024-25 season at Real Madrid: Ancelotti helpedAfter a turbulent end to last season, Real Madrid's Rodrygo Goes opened up about his personal struggles. Watch: Prithvi Shaw flings his bat at ex-Mumbai teammates in heated exchangePrithvi Shaw was seen involved in a heated verbal exchange following his dismissal when playing against his former team, Mumbai in the warm-up clash.

MS Dhoni earns his wings: Former India captain becomes certified drone pilotMS Dhoni has added drone piloting to his list of passions, earning a DGCA-certified drone pilot license. He completed his training at Garuda Aerospace's DGCA-approved center in Chennai.

No guarantee that Kohli and Rohit will play World Cup 2027: AB de VilliersLegendary South Africa batter AB de Villiers has expressed doubts over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's participation in the ODI World Cup 2027. PAK rolls out free, super-cheap tickets for SA Tests to tackle poor crowdsPakistan Cricket Board has rolled out free and super-affordable tickets for their upcoming two-Test series against South Africa, hoping to revive fan interest. The move comes amid a worrying trend of low turnouts for Test cricket across Asia, including India.

Prithvi Shaw hits daddy hundred vs former team Mumbai before Ranji comebackOut-of-favour India batter made a statement on Tuesday, hitting a daddy hundred for Maharashtra against Mumbai, his former team, in a warm-up match in Pune ahead of the upcoming Ranji Trophy season.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi needs to be fast-tracked like Sachin: Ex-cricketerRajasthan Royals' director of cricket Zubin Barucha wants Vaibhav Suryavanshi to be fast-tracked to the Indian team. The 14-year-old has been dominating age-group cricket around the world.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
